title: Who introduced Christianity to the Romans? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technically, Jesus himself as he is executed as a local cult leader with potential revolt risk… In fact, by his followers who spread the idea during exile… Christianity is extremely seditious to the lower class and spread fast in pariahs and women…until one day become too influential to be ignored as a tool to stabilize the crowd by the emperor… The rest is history…BTW, the burning cross part is still cool even for today’s standard…

If by Romans you mean people actually living in the city of Rome, then actually nobody knows, but there is that intriguing reference to ‘visitors from Rome’ present at Pentecost. Did one of them take the message back to Rome? Certainly Christianity arrived in Rome amazingly early, and was well established by the time Paul wrote his Letter to the Romans.
